author: killari.
content: I don't like that being a big name in the field gets you preferential treatment on the process. I think this should not be allowed. I feel strongly that this is wrong and should not be tolerated

author: sky.cactus
content:
<@689161464829050960> Can we special case this line:
```
eip: <to be assigned>
```

author: sky.cactus
content: Right now it complains about being a non-negative integer.  Would be better if it said nothing or mentioned editors asking for number assignment, or said "please wait for an editor to assign you a number".

author: sky.cactus
content: Actually, at the moment you get two errors on that line, one for "not a non-negative integer" and one for "this file's name should be `eip-<to be assigned>.md`".

author: sky.cactus
content: Note: I am *super* happy with the bot commenting on the PR, so consider this a low priority nit pick.

author: sky.cactus
content: Similar it would be nice if there was a special case for `[CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).` that just suggests changing it to a relative link, rather than complaining about no external links.

author: sky.cactus
content: Is there a way to make it so the bot will comment on the PR when it makes the suggestions?  They don't show up in the discussion page at all nor is there email notification, so I'm worried users won't actually see the suggestions.

author: samwilsn
content: So an actual PR comment, in addition to the annotations it adds now?

author: sky.cactus
content: In a perfect world, the bot would do a PR review with suggestions/comments on each line just like a human.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm guessing that is hard though, so next best would be to at least have the bot let the user know via a comment "hey, check out the files tab to see initial feedback/suggestions".

author: sky.cactus
content: At the moment there is zero notifications.

author: samwilsn
content: That's a good idea.

author: samwilsn
content:
Would you rather:

```
= help: an EIP editor will assign a number
```

Or would you prefer matching the text `<to be assigned>` and squelching the error?

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm...

author: sky.cactus
content: I would have to think of it, my gut is on the fence.

author: killari.
content: https://twitter.com/ashekhirin/status/1547241124296794112 eip5000 is being advertised :/

author: sky.cactus
content: Further strengthens my resolve to punish severely.

author: samwilsn
content: In any case, we should come to a resolution quickly.
